verses.text_plain: Who hath believed our report? and to whom is the arm of the Lord revealed?
verses.verse_html:
1Who hath believed our report? and to whom is the arm of the Lord revealed? ▼
▼ report: or, doctrine?: Heb. hearing?

tokens.text: and to whom is the arm

footnotes.body_html: ▼ report: or, doctrine?: Heb. hearing?

verses.text_plain: For he shall grow up before him as a tender plant, and as a root out of a dry ground: he hath no form nor comeliness; and when we shall see him, there is no beauty that we should desire him.
verses.verse_html: 2For he shall grow up before him as a tender plant, and as a root out of a dry ground: he hath no form nor comeliness; and when we shall see him, there is no beauty that we should desire him.

verses.text_plain: He is despised and rejected of men; a man of sorrows, and acquainted with grief: and we hid as it were our faces from him; he was despised, and we esteemed him not.
verses.verse_html:
3He is despised and rejected of men; a man of sorrows, and acquainted with grief: and we hid as it were our faces from him; he was despised, and we esteemed him not. ▼
▼ we hid…: or, he hid as it were his face from us: Heb. as an hiding of faces from him, or, from us

tokens.text: and we hid as it were

footnotes.body_text: ▼ we hid…: or, he hid as it were his face from us: Heb. as an hiding of faces from him, or, from us
footnotes.body_html: ▼ we hid…: or, he hid as it were his face from us: Heb. as an hiding of faces from him, or, from us

verses.text_plain: Surely he hath borne our griefs, and carried our sorrows: yet we did esteem him stricken, smitten of God, and afflicted.
verses.verse_html: 4Surely he hath borne our griefs, and carried our sorrows: yet we did esteem him stricken, smitten of God, and afflicted.

verses.text_plain: But he was wounded for our transgressions, he was bruised for our iniquities: the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and with his stripes we are healed.
verses.verse_html:
5But he was wounded for our transgressions, he was bruised for our iniquities: the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and with his stripes we are healed. ▼
▼ wounded: or, tormented
 , ▼
▼ stripes: Heb. bruise

tokens.text: upon him; and with his stripes

verses.text_plain: All we like sheep have gone astray; we have turned every one to his own way; and the Lord hath laid on him the iniquity of us all.
verses.verse_html:
6All we like sheep have gone astray; we have turned every one to his own way; and the Lord hath laid on him the iniquity of us all. ▼
▼ laid…: Heb. made the iniquity of us all to meet on him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ laid…: Heb. made the iniquity of us all to meet on him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ laid…: Heb. made the iniquity of us all to meet on him

verses.text_plain: He was oppressed, and he was afflicted, yet he opened not his mouth: he is brought as a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is dumb, so he openeth not his mouth.
verses.verse_html: 7He was oppressed, and he was afflicted, yet he opened not his mouth: he is brought as a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is dumb, so he openeth not his mouth.

verses.text_plain: He was taken from prison and from judgment: and who shall declare his generation? for he was cut off out of the land of the living: for the transgression of my people was he stricken.
verses.verse_html:
8He was taken from prison and from judgment: and who shall declare his generation? for he was cut off out of the land of the living: for the transgression of my people was he stricken. ▼
▼ from prison…: or, away by distress and judgment: but, etc
 , ▼
▼ was he…: Heb. was the stroke upon him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ from prison…: or, away by distress and judgment: but, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ from prison…: or, away by distress and judgment: but, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ was he…: Heb. was the stroke upon him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ was he…: Heb. was the stroke upon him

verses.text_plain: And he made his grave with the wicked, and with the rich in his death; because he had done no violence, neither was any deceit in his mouth.
verses.verse_html:
9And he made his grave with the wicked, and with the rich in his death; because he had done no violence, neither was any deceit in his mouth. ▼
▼ death: Heb. deaths

verses.text_plain: Yet it pleased the Lord to bruise him; he hath put him to grief: when thou shalt make his soul an offering for sin, he shall see his seed, he shall prolong his days, and the pleasure of the Lord shall prosper in his hand.
verses.verse_html:
10Yet it pleased the Lord to bruise him; he hath put him to grief: when thou shalt make his soul an offering for sin, he shall see his seed, he shall prolong his days, and the pleasure of the Lord shall prosper in his hand. ▼
▼ thou…: or, his soul shall make an offering

footnotes.body_text: ▼ thou…: or, his soul shall make an offering
footnotes.body_html: ▼ thou…: or, his soul shall make an offering

verses.text_plain: He shall see of the travail of his soul, and shall be satisfied: by his knowledge shall my righteous servant justify many; for he shall bear their iniquities.
verses.verse_html: 11He shall see of the travail of his soul, and shall be satisfied: by his knowledge shall my righteous servant justify many; for he shall bear their iniquities.

verses.text_plain: Therefore will I divide him a portion with the great, and he shall divide the spoil with the strong; because he hath poured out his soul unto death: and he was numbered with the transgressors; and he bare the sin of many, and made intercession for the transgressors.
verses.verse_html: 12Therefore will I divide him a portion with the great, and he shall divide the spoil with the strong; because he hath poured out his soul unto death: and he was numbered with the transgressors; and he bare the sin of many, and made intercession for the transgressors.
